570: About You You are an experienced chemist or environmental scientist or engineer with experience writing SAPs and QAPPS for sediment and upland site characterization, environmental analyses, and supporting field programs. You are a strategic thinker who thrives on the challenges of these complex, interdisciplinary environmental matters. A lifelong learner, you want to keep growing intellectually and professionally. Collaborating with colleagues with diverse expertise is exciting for you, and you are also comfortable working independently. You effectively manage tasks and projects, oversee and delegate technical tasks, produce high quality deliverables, and exceed internal and external client expectations. About the Job We are currently seeking a mid-level Scientist in our Investigation and Remediation business area. Preferred disciplines are chemistry or environmental science with a chemistry focus. The successful candidate will be a detail-oriented, well-organized, experienced individual who can provide technical and strategic contribution on client projects related to upland sites. The candidate will have rich and varied experience in preparation of SAPs and QAPPs, quality assurance, managing subcontractors, have a high degree of technical competence, and be able to effectively communicate with internal and external clients. The ideal candidate will work independently and take direction from clients and senior leadership and ensure that tasks are executed on time and accurately by the project team. Responsibilities As a mid-level scientist, your job functions will include, but not be limited to: Preparing QAPPs and SAPs Managing laboratory and data validation subcontractors Supporting field programs by organizing, tracking, and reporting for sample collection and field activities Performing quality assurance reviews of technical analyses and results Performing technical tasks supporting fate and transport evaluations Researching, summarizing, and preparing technical reports and environmental data Qualifications Candidates should hold B.S. degree in chemistry, geology, environmental science, environmental or civil engineering, or related technical field. The ideal candidate will have: 3+ years of professional experience Field and/or laboratory experience desired Proficiency with current MS Office products (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) Strong quantitative and problem solving skills Strong oral and written communication skills A desire to grow intellectually and professionally Annual Salary Range: $65,000 - $85,000 An employee’s total compensation package includes annual salary, company-subsidized (employee and family) medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) participation with a company-match of 1% to 4% of annual compensation, company-paid life and short- and long-term disability, paid sick leave (80 hours per year), paid vacation (10 days or 12 days; determined by title at hire), paid holidays (9 days per year), and the potential for an annual discretionary bonus based on company performance.
